channel.title: [Q] ::say command + #adm#
channel.description:
I have tried various ways to try and implement the #adm# crown in with the ::say command and no luck.
It compiles perfectly well, then when in game the command will work, however the #adm# icon isn't there. There is just a space at the front of the username, as though something should be there.
[code]sb.append("#adm#").append(player.getUsername()).append(": @gre@");[/code]
If anyone can point me in the right direction, it would be greatly appreciated.
Regards,
Yong-Min

item.title: [Q] ::say command + #adm#
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

Benz:

When regularly typing, does the administrator icon appear when you type “#adm#”?

Yes, regular typing does show the icon for administrator.

@dear god and xEnt: Thank you both for your replies. I will surely check this when I have some more time.

Your help is much appreciated.

Regards,

Yong-Min

@dear god: I will PM you it right away ^^[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 25, 2009, 06:34:23 am[/size][hr]Neither way still seems to be working.

If anyone else has any ideas, it will be greatly appreciated.

Regards,

Yong-Min

Read full topic

item.title: [Q] ::say command + #adm#
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

sb.append("#adm# + player.getUsername() + “: @gre@”);

Read full topic

item.title: [Q] ::say command + #adm#
item.dc:creator: @dear_god1 dear god
item.description:
@dear_god1 wrote:

Change it to this:

sb.append().append("#adm#" + player.getUsername()).append(": @gre@");

Also pm me your msn.

Read full topic
